summary: This is a cover email from defense attorney Christian Everdell to Judge Nathan and counsel, transmitting a letter to be filed under seal regarding a renewed bail motion in the criminal case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell. It demonstrates ongoing pre-trial legal proceedings.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP sending a sealed letter to the court regarding a renewed bail motion for Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Named in the email recipient list, likely part of the defense legal team for Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Bobbi C Sternheim
persons.context: Named in the email recipient list, likely part of the defense legal team for Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Named in the email recipient list, likely part of the defense legal team for Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced (U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (MN)). The sealed letter concerns a renewed bail motion on her behalf.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The federal judge presiding over the criminal case, to whom the sealed letter regarding the bail motion is addressed.

connections.description: Everdell is transmitting a sealed bail motion letter to the court on behalf of defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.
Cohen is listed as a recipient on the email concerning Maxwell's bail motion, indicating he is part of her defense team.
Sternheim is listed as a recipient on the email concerning Maxwell's bail motion, indicating she is part of her defense team.
Menninger is listed as a recipient on the email concerning Maxwell's bail motion, indicating she is part of her defense team.
Everdell is formally corresponding with Judge Nathan, the presiding judge, regarding a procedural matter (sealing a bail motion).

events.title: Submission of Sealed Bail Motion Letter
events.description: Defense attorney Christian Everdell submits a letter to Judge Nathan to be filed under seal, concerning a renewed bail motion for Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: Cohen & Gresser LLP, 800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022
keyFacts: The document is a cover email for a sealed letter regarding a renewed bail motion in the case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
The defense legal team at this stage included Christian Everdell, Mark S. Cohen, Bobbi C Sternheim, and Laura Menninger.
The correspondence is addressed to Judge Nathan, indicating she was the presiding judge over the pre-trial proceedings.
The email and attached letter were intended to be confidential and filed under seal, highlighting the sensitive nature of the bail arguments.
The document date is November 25, 2020, during Maxwell's pre-trial detention period.
